definition: to rest/to take a break/to stop/to halt/(dialect) to sleep/a moment/a short while
to stop in the middle of sth/intermittent/intermittence
to close down (temporarily or permanently)/to go out of business
Michel or Mitchell (name)/George Mitchell (1933-), US Democratic party politician and diplomat, influential in brokering Northern Ireland peace deal in 1990s, US Middle East special envoy from 2009
Marshall (name)/George Catlett Marshall (1880-1959), US general in WWII and Secretary of State 1947-1949, author of the postwar Marshall plan for Europe and Nobel peace laureate
to have a rest/to stay for the night/to go to bed/to sleep
to stop on the way for a rest
saying in which the second part, uttered after a pause or totally left out, is the intended meaning of the allegory presented in the first part
to go to bed/to retire for the night
Lake Michigan, one of the Great Lakes 五大湖[Wu3 da4 hu2]

sentences.english: You've worked hard, and perhaps you have no plans to slow down now.
sentences.chinese: 你曾努力地工作，也许现在还没有歇一歇的打算。

sentences.english: An Ultra Orthodox Jewish girl stands on a street in the religious neighborhood of Mea Shearim in Jerusalem.
sentences.chinese: 一名正统犹太小女孩站在耶路撒冷歇雷姆区的大街上。

sentences.english: Along the stone corridor of the battlement, two figures were slouched down against the wall.
sentences.chinese: 战壕的石头通道边上，有两个人挨着墙歇着。
你先和爷爷一起歇着吧。

sentences.english: Two little black birds are sitting on a hill.
sentences.chinese: 两只小黑鹂正歇在一座小山上。

sentences.english: After a time the bull gave up and sank down to rest again.
sentences.chinese: 过了一会儿，公牛不撞了，倒下歇着。

sentences.english: We should all take a little break.
sentences.chinese: 我们都应该稍微歇一下了。

sentences.english: One flight up Dalla ran, and paused for a moment, panting.
sentences.chinese: 德拉一口气跑上一段楼梯，喘息着歇了一会儿。

sentences.english: Out of the rain, looking for sunshine.
sentences.chinese: 雨渐渐歇停，我找寻那束阳光。

sentences.english: Mia just wanted to rest and catch her breath.
sentences.chinese: 米雅只想休息一下，歇口气。

sentences.english: Where do you make it lie down at noon?
sentences.chinese: 晌午在何处使羊群歇卧？

sentences.english: Then, one morning his father told him to stay at home and his father would do the chores.
sentences.chinese: 后来有一天，他的爸爸要去做家务，让他在家里歇着。

sentences.english: She is to take a day off on Thursday.
sentences.chinese: 她准备星期四歇一天工。

sentences.english: This pause for tea became a fashionable social event.
sentences.chinese: 自此之后，茶歇就成了一种社会潮流。

sentences.english: He took a rest in the shade of a tree.
sentences.chinese: 他在树阴下歇了一会儿。

sentences.english: Rob: Those are different situations where you can take the weight off your feet.
sentences.chinese: 这就是‘歇一歇’的几种不同的使用场景。

definition: to have a rest/to stay for the night/to go to bed/to sleep
to rest for a bit/to take a breather
to go to bed/to retire for the night
to snatch a moment of leisure/to take a break from work/also written 偷閒|偷闲[tou1 xian2]
to snatch a moment of leisure/to take a break from work
to hasten on with one's journey/to hurry on
